intro: Narthecium caucasicum, commonly known as the Caucasian mouse-ear, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. It has a short growing season and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its range.
